profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-07-16T10:55-0400

change.item: Edited to reflect updated administrative information

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: Morris Golden was a Communist activist in the American Labor Party and United Federal Workers of America. Collection contains papers pertaining to Golden's political work, particularly with the American Labor Party and United Federal Workers of America in the 1940s. Includes minutes, correspondence, and pamphlets.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Morris Golden was a Communist activist in the American Labor Party and United Federal Workers of America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Papers pertaining to Golden's political work, particularly with the American Labor Party and United Federal Workers of America in the 1940s. Includes minutes, correspondence, and pamphlets.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Collection was likely donated by Frances Golden. The accession number associated with this collection is 2008.056.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain beginning in 2065. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.
